reviewText:
What a great way to get rid of an un-wanted house guest. Keep a copy of this film close at hand, and when you have had just about all you can take, put this film into your dvd player and hit the play button.
If they haven't high-tailed it out your door within 15 minutes, pray for a visit from Freddy.

I don't even know how to explain this, because I've never seen it before. Simply, I didn't find a single actor to act well in this movie, although it was not a low budget movie. My boyfriend just said that they wrote "Looking for low budget actors" for the casting. If you liked "Legally Blonde" don't watch this one, they have nothing in common. By the way the camera guy shooting during the landscape scenes is great, but the one that shoots during people talk obviously doesn't know how to hold the camera. So obviously it was the worst movie I've seen in a lot of time and I regret I choose to watch this one instead of "Disaster movie"

1/5

i like this movie. it's seems decent and it seems like it's more for younger viewers. i do think that the original was more funnier, though. it's really cute that one twin wears dark pink and the other wears light pink. they look really pretty. they are like the mini versions of paris hilton. they even have little chihuahuas as pets just like her! and i love their british accents. sounds so posh and well-mannered.

I love blondes and am giving these 2 girls 5/5 stars! ;-P I love their sexy British accents... ;-) Produced by the Original "Legally Blonde" (Elle Woods) Reese Witherspoon herself, this delightful comedy tells of her distant UK relations, Annie and Izzy Woods, who were given the chance to study in the USA on a partial scholarship. It tells of their misadventures with a jealous schoolmate as they try to fit into the clique-obssessed elite school culture. The story culminates in a school courtroom scene whereby one of the UK sisters is tasked to defend her sister and a male schoolmate of theft and cheating at a school exam (test?). All went went as the jealous female schoolmate whose dad owns school gets caught in her own lies and is expelled. Happy ending for the blonde girls as they get together in the end. Now, will the original Elle Woods (aka. Reese Witherspoon) please come back for post-graduate studies?! Recommended viewing: Legally Blonde / Legally Blonde 2 - Red, White and Blonde
I like these twin sisters Milly and Becky Rosso because they are really cute!  Milly and Becky have healthy sexy bodies.  They are identical twin sisters. I like this movie alot.

Legally Blondes was basically a rip-off of Legally Blonde except instead of Elle Woods, there were Annabelle (Annie) and Isabelle (Izzy) from across the pond. Many of the characters are like the ones in Legally Blonde: Sylvia is like Paulette, Chris is like Emmett, Mr. Golden is like the UPS Guy, Tiffany is like a Vivian (kind of), and Warner is like Justin. They also have a thing called the "flip and wave" (ehhm, bend and snap anyone?) that they teach Sylvia. The thing is basically all about how blondes shouldn't be underestimated & has a "trial" at the end. It was an okay movie, it would've been better if they hadn't copied off of the original.

if you like stupid sickening sequels to very good movies this is the movie for you.  this stupid movie is about two stick thin fake haired twin blondes who *suprise* move to cali to attend a strick boarding school. never saw that coming.  this is one of the worst movies i have EVER watched and i am soo dissapionted reeese witherspoon had anything to do with it.
 so if you want to watch a movie that is soooooo prodictable and has 2 dumb blonde twins who will turn out to be paris hiltons then watch this.
This movie is very great. It has the same charm and stick up for your self power that the first two movies had. It is incredibly charming and sweet.

I have no idea why Reese Witherspoon would associate her name to this film.  She is a top Hollywood actress and this movie is pure garbage. As the first two movies in the series are focused toward an older audience, this is driven straight toward tweens.  The production value is pretty much worthless even for a tween movie.  Pure and simple, this movie is a cruel joke with the butt of the joke being the intelligence of the viewer.  Tween or not, avoid this movie at all costs.  It is quite possible that this movie beats out Dark Harvest 2 as the worst movie of all time.

Why? Why? Why?

Legally Blondes is a really good movie. Granted it's not as good as the original Legally Blonde movie but hey it's still really good.

This movie is about Elle Woods twin cousins (Annabelle and Isabelle Woods) who come to town from the UK. Their father just got a teaching job in California. Elle Woods does NOT make an appearance in the film BUT she is talked about a lot in the film. In fact the twins and their dad stay in Elle Woods house and there are a lot of paintings of Elle Woods and Bruiser displayed in the house. The girls go to the same Prep school as Elle so they are well known by the principal and not well liked by her and some of their classmates. One of the girls gets accused of cheating (I think it is Isabelle) so Annabelle and their friends have to present a case and evidence to prove that Isabelle is innocent. Watch the movie to see if the girls and their friends can save the day.

There are some similarities about the Legally Blonde movies and the Legally Blondes movie.  Elle, Annabelle, and Isabelle all love pink, they all have chihuahua's as pets (in fact Elle buys her cousins the dogs), and all three movies involve law type cases.

I watched the previous two Legally Blonde movies and rather enjoyed them, so I thought I'd give this one a try. Unfortunately, it was so much less enjoyable than either of the previous two films that I turned it off less than a half hour into the film. The British twin characters were both unpleasant, unlikeable, and unrelatable. The character of Elle from the previous two films, while similarly rich and Valley Girl, was written and portrayed in a way that didn't scream "I am a superficial Material Girl who is willing to scam, cheat, and lie to get what I want cause I'm blonde and boys think I'm pretty, like, duh". There was no compelling or driving scene that made any sense. Honestly, if you liked the Legally Blonde films with Reese Witherspoon, give this one a hard pass. It's on a different level from those two films and quite frankly, that level is a much lower one.

OMG! Can this really be the "offspring" of "Legally Blond?" Up until the last 10%, I couldn't even figure out how it had anything to do with legal/law. It did have blonds. The movie meanders about pointlessly, with a few groaners for comical "one liners." It's as though the franchise was high-jacked by some horrible high-school production---and that's an insult to most high school productions. Wow. Although the production value was good (shockingly produced by Reese Witherspoon) the writing was bottom-of-the-barrel. How disappointing.

Within 10 minutes as a Brit I'm highly offended by how this film conveys Britain and British fashion. Lines such as "Wow look at these cars!" as the girls drive around for the first time makes it sound like we have just minis... yet the line should be "Wow these cars are terrible". Then there is how they claim to be in fashion heaven when all these shops are in Central London and even Westfields. Then there is their terrible "English" accents that I have never met anyone with one like theirs.

It is also bizzare that they complain at uniforms when about 98% of schools in England has uniforms... this film just again and again seems to just like ratting at a poor english sterotype which is all offensive...

If that is what Americans see us Brits as they really need a reality check but this is just a poor film compared to the two wonderful Legally Blonde films that were wonderful. Don't be disappointed and avoid as it will just have you vomiting (especially if you are a brit).

Legally Blondes was a belated attempt to milk the Legally Blonde franchise for one last time. It was released in 2009 as a made for dvd film rather than for cinema release. Unfortunately no Reese Witherspoon in this one - the nearest she got to it was as Producer.

There are attempts to link this film to the previous two Legally Blondes in various ways. The twins, Izzy and Annie, who star are Elle Wood's cousins who share her liking for pink, cute dogs etc. As a piece of trivia, one of the chihuahua's in this film is Bruiser who was also in the original Legally Blonde film. The twins are English and move to California to live in Elle's house with their widowed father. They attend a private school and get involved in cheating allegations in a school test and seek to clear Izzy's name.

Quite a light weight offering, clearly directed more at younger viewers than the previous two Legally Blonde films were. It probably works for this audience but adults may well find it disappointing. If you want this film the Legally Blonde Boxset [DVD], containing all three Legally Blonde films probably represents better value.

Legally Blondes was a whole lot better than Legally Blonde because Milly and Becky Russo were too cute and I love their accents. The movie was about Annabelle (Annie) and Isabelle (Izzy), as they fit into their new private school (Pack Prep is the nickname) in California, where they move. It had plenty of character and all the producers from Legally Blonde (Was his name Scott?) came back. I want to make a book adaption on my computer for this movie. I hope they make a sequel. Also, remember these healthy tips:

Blonde Rule #1: Pink looks good with anything.

Blonde Rule #2: Never pay retail!

I enjoyed Legally Blond first (rate 5), and Legally Blond second (rate 5) was not too bad, so when I was looking for something light, I picked up this Legally Blondes. Never I expected this movie would be this LIGHT (well, they don't have 0 point something)!

I think the story is far from original. If there are many people who want to see this, it must be because it's title and how it mentions Elle Woods (who didn't appear for the whole movie)! So unfair!

The dialogs between the twins were like a joke. The acting was awful and the play itself didn't help much. The movie was just too full of exaggerations (and most of them are not so enjoyable to see).

The DVD ended in my trash after some fast forwards. What a waste of my time and money. I would never recommend this movie to anybody!
Great movie, following after Legally Blonde

If you always wanted to watch two teenage Natasha Richardson clones in a movie that seems to be nothing more than a series of montages, this movie is for you. Watch as they shop! Watch as they pool party! See them liven up their school uniforms by adding an entire Michael's craft store to their blazers! Hold on, now it's time for Skipper and Barbie to solve a school mystery! Jump cut filled montage after cut away filled montage, all set to upbeat irritating pop music. I seriously don't know what the plot even was, unless the plot was Montages: A Montage.

I guess what I'm saying is, I'll be giving this to everyone I hate every Christmas until I die.
